t: Psalm 35
The Lord the Avenger of His People
A Psalm of David.
Plead*pn my*i cause,*i O Lord,*s with those who strive with me; Fight*ld against those who fight against me.
Take*ld hold of shield and buckler, And*ld stand up for my help.
Also*ld draw out the spear, And*ld stop those who pursue me. Say*ld to my soul, “I*ld am*i your salvation.”
Let*ln those be put to shame and brought to dishonor Who*ld seek after my life; Let*ld those be turned back and brought to confusion Who*ld plot my hurt.
Let*ld them be like chaff before the wind, And*ld let the angel of the Lord*s chase them.*i
Let*ld their way be dark and slippery, And*ld let the angel of the Lord*s pursue them.
For*ld without cause they have hidden their net for me in*i a pit, Which*ild they have dug without cause for my life.
Let*ld destruction come upon him unexpectedly, And*ld let his net that he has hidden catch himself; Into*ld that very destruction let him fall.
And*ln my soul shall be joyful in the Lord;*s It*ld shall rejoice in His salvation.
All*ld my bones shall say, “Lord,*sld who is*i like You, Delivering*ld the poor from him who is too strong for him, Yes,*ld the poor and the needy from him who plunders him?”
Fierce*ln witnesses rise up; They*ld ask me things*i that I do not know.
They*ld reward me evil for good, To*ild the sorrow of my soul.
But*ld as for me, when they were sick, My*ld clothing was*i sackcloth; I*ld humbled myself with fasting; And*ld my prayer would return to my own heart.
I*ld paced about as though he*i were*i my friend or*i brother; I*ld bowed down heavily, as one who mourns for*i his*i mother.
But*ln in my adversity they rejoiced And*ld gathered together; Attackers*ld gathered against me, And*ld I did not know it;*i They*ld tore at*i me*i and did not cease;
With*ld ungodly mockers at feasts They*ld gnashed at me with their teeth.
Lord,*ln how long will You look on? Rescue*ld me from their destructions, My*ld precious life*i from the lions.
I*ld will give You thanks in the great assembly; I*ld will praise You among many people.
Let*ln them not rejoice over me who are wrongfully my enemies; Nor*ld let them wink with the eye who hate me without a cause.
For*ld they do not speak peace, But*ld they devise deceitful matters Against*ld the*i quiet ones in the land.
They*ld also opened their mouth wide against me, And*ild said, “Aha, aha! Our*ld eyes have seen it.”*i
This*iln You have seen, O Lord;*s Do*ld not keep silence. O*ld Lord, do not be far from me.
Stir*ld up Yourself, and awake to my vindication, To*ld my cause, my God and my Lord.
Vindicate*ld me, O Lord*s my God, according to Your righteousness; And*ld let them not rejoice over me.
Let*ld them not say in their hearts, “Ah, so we would have it!” Let*ld them not say, “We have swallowed him up.”
Let*ln them be ashamed and brought to mutual confusion Who*ld rejoice at my hurt; Let*ld them be clothed with shame and dishonor Who*ld exalt themselves against me.
Let*ln them shout for joy and be glad, Who*ld favor my righteous cause; And*ld let them say continually, “Let*ld the Lord*s be magnified, Who*ld has pleasure in the prosperity of His servant.”
And*ld my tongue shall speak of Your righteousness And*ild of Your praise all the day long.
